'863635c3-89d9-4268-9683-324619182b7c': {'@type': 'dividerBlock', 'hidden': True, 'styles': {}}, '88074407-3a3a-44e5-b574-474a82e5af0b': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': "Freshwater that we use comes from different sources like rivers, lakes, groundwater, and even snow and ice. When it rains, or when the snow melts, or when water flows in from neighboring countries, it adds more water to our water resources. However, some of it also returns to the atmosphere when it evaporates from reservoirs, lakes, and soil, or when it is used up by plants. The overall result of these processes builds our country's renewable freshwater resources, which are replenished year-round. Because of climate change, the amount of fresh water we can rely on varies a lot from year to year. This makes it hard to predict how much we will have in the future.", 'value': [{'children': [{'text': "Freshwater that we use comes from different sources like rivers, lakes, groundwater, and even snow and ice. When it rains, or when the snow melts, or when water flows in from neighboring countries, it adds more water to our water resources. However, some of it also returns to the atmosphere when it evaporates from reservoirs, lakes, and soil, or when it is used up by plants. The overall result of these processes builds our country's renewable freshwater resources, which are replenished year-round. Because of climate change, the amount of fresh water we can rely on varies a lot from year to year. This makes it hard to predict how much we will have in the future."}], 'type': 'callout'}]}, '95ad8579-5f03-4561-b7cd-e296e03e2fc7': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': 'Development of our freshwater '3c8e1354-1561-4fe0-bb05-c99e77b7d656': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': 'In many cases, water needs to be transported from rivers, lakes, or reservoirs to the places where it is used, such as in households, agriculture, and industry. During this transport, some of the water is lost due to leakages in the water conveyance systems or simply returned to the atmosphere through evaporation or absorbed into the soil. Decreasing leakages and losses reduces the abstraction of water from surface and groundwater resources, as well as lowers the costs of water treatment and supply. This also helps improve our resilience to droughts and water scarcity caused by climate change.', 'value': [{'children': [{'text': 'In many cases, water needs to be transported from rivers, lakes, or reservoirs to the places where it is used, such as in households, agriculture, and industry. During this transport, some of the water is lost due to leakages in the water conveyance systems or simply returned to the atmosphere through evaporation or absorbed into the soil. Decreasing leakages and losses reduces the abstraction of water from surface and groundwater resources, as well as lowers the costs of water treatment and supply. This also helps improve our resilience to droughts and water scarcity caused by climate change.'}], 'type': 'callout'}]}, '42488b55-f29b-4c85-8ebe-bac14ee1172d': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': 'Our communities and our economy mostly rely on surface water (rivers, lakes, reservoirs) and groundwater resources. The EU Water Framework Directive promotes sustainable water use based on a long-term protection of available water resources.', 'value': [{'children': [{'text': 'Our communities and our economy mostly rely on surface water (rivers, lakes, reservoirs) and groundwater resources. 'hidden': True, 'section': False, 'styles': {}}, '82279940-2ce4-4740-bb51-3055b444dab4': {'@type': 'dividerBlock', 'hidden': False, 'styles': {}}, '863635c3-89d9-4268-9683-324619182b7c': {'@type': 'dividerBlock', 'hidden': True, 'styles': {}}, '88074407-3a3a-44e5-b574-474a82e5af0b': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': "Freshwater that we use comes from different sources like rivers, lakes, groundwater, and even snow and ice. When it rains, or when the snow melts, or when water flows in from neighboring countries, it adds more water to our water resources. However, some of it also returns to the atmosphere when it evaporates from reservoirs, lakes, and soil, or when it is used up by plants. The overall result of these processes builds our country's renewable freshwater resources, which are replenished year-round. Because of climate change, the amount of fresh water we can rely on varies a lot from year to year. This makes it hard to predict how much we will have in the future.", 'value': [{'children': [{'text': "Freshwater that we use comes from different sources like rivers, lakes, groundwater, and even snow and ice. When it rains, or when the snow melts, or when water flows in from neighboring countries, it adds more water to our water resources. However, some of it also returns to the atmosphere when it evaporates from reservoirs, lakes, and soil, or when it is used up by plants. The overall result of these processes builds our country's renewable freshwater resources, which are replenished year-round. Because of climate change, the amount of fresh water we can rely on varies a lot from year to year. 'section': True, 'styles': {}}, '3c8e1354-1561-4fe0-bb05-c99e77b7d656': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': 'In many cases, water needs to be transported from rivers, lakes, or reservoirs to the places where it is used, such as in households, agriculture, and industry. During this transport, some of the water is lost due to leakages in the water conveyance systems or simply returned to the atmosphere through evaporation or absorbed into the soil. Decreasing leakages and losses reduces the abstraction of water from surface and groundwater resources, as well as lowers the costs of water treatment and supply. This also helps improve our resilience to droughts and water scarcity caused by climate change.', 'value': [{'children': [{'text': 'In many cases, water needs to be transported from rivers, lakes, or reservoirs to the places where it is used, such as in households, agriculture, and industry. During this transport, some of the water is lost due to leakages in the water conveyance systems or simply returned to the atmosphere through evaporation or absorbed into the soil. Decreasing leakages and losses reduces the abstraction of water from surface and groundwater resources, as well as lowers the costs of water treatment and supply. This also helps improve our resilience to droughts and water scarcity caused by climate change.'}], 'type': 'callout'}]}, '42488b55-f29b-4c85-8ebe-bac14ee1172d': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': 'Our communities and our economy mostly rely on surface water (rivers, lakes, reservoirs) and groundwater resources. '863635c3-89d9-4268-9683-324619182b7c': {'@type': 'dividerBlock', 'hidden': True, 'styles': {}}, '88074407-3a3a-44e5-b574-474a82e5af0b': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': "Freshwater that we use comes from different sources like rivers, lakes, groundwater, and even snow and ice. When it rains, or when the snow melts, or when water flows in from neighboring countries, it adds more water to our water resources. However, some of it also returns to the atmosphere when it evaporates from reservoirs, lakes, and soil, or when it is used up by plants. The overall result of these processes builds our country's renewable freshwater resources, which are replenished year-round. Because of climate change, the amount of fresh water we can rely on varies a lot from year to year. This makes it hard to predict how much we will have in the future.", 'value': [{'children': [{'text': "Freshwater that we use comes from different sources like rivers, lakes, groundwater, and even snow and ice. When it rains, or when the snow melts, or when water flows in from neighboring countries, it adds more water to our water resources. However, some of it also returns to the atmosphere when it evaporates from reservoirs, lakes, and soil, or when it is used up by plants. The overall result of these processes builds our country's renewable freshwater resources, which are replenished year-round. Because of climate change, the amount of fresh water we can rely on varies a lot from year to year. This makes it hard to predict how much we will have in the future."}], 'type': 'callout'}]}, '95ad8579-5f03-4561-b7cd-e296e03e2fc7': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': 'Development of our freshwater '3c8e1354-1561-4fe0-bb05-c99e77b7d656': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': 'In many cases, water needs to be transported from rivers, lakes, or reservoirs to the places where it is used, such as in households, agriculture, and industry. During this transport, some of the water is lost due to leakages in the water conveyance systems or simply returned to the atmosphere through evaporation or absorbed into the soil. Decreasing leakages and losses reduces the abstraction of water from surface and groundwater resources, as well as lowers the costs of water treatment and supply. This also helps improve our resilience to droughts and water scarcity caused by climate change.', 'value': [{'children': [{'text': 'In many cases, water needs to be transported from rivers, lakes, or reservoirs to the places where it is used, such as in households, agriculture, and industry. During this transport, some of the water is lost due to leakages in the water conveyance systems or simply returned to the atmosphere through evaporation or absorbed into the soil. Decreasing leakages and losses reduces the abstraction of water from surface and groundwater resources, as well as lowers the costs of water treatment and supply. This also helps improve our resilience to droughts and water scarcity caused by climate change.'}], 'type': 'callout'}]}, '42488b55-f29b-4c85-8ebe-bac14ee1172d': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': 'Our communities and our economy mostly rely on surface water (rivers, lakes, reservoirs) and groundwater resources. 'dividerBlock', 'hidden': True, 'styles': {}}, '88074407-3a3a-44e5-b574-474a82e5af0b': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': "Freshwater that we use comes from different sources like rivers, lakes, groundwater, and even snow and ice. When it rains, or when the snow melts, or when water flows in from neighboring countries, it adds more water to our water resources. However, some of it also returns to the atmosphere when it evaporates from reservoirs, lakes, and soil, or when it is used up by plants. The overall result of these processes builds our country's renewable freshwater resources, which are replenished year-round. Because of climate change, the amount of fresh water we can rely on varies a lot from year to year. This makes it hard to predict how much we will have in the future.", 'value': [{'children': [{'text': "Freshwater that we use comes from different sources like rivers, lakes, groundwater, and even snow and ice. When it rains, or when the snow melts, or when water flows in from neighboring countries, it adds more water to our water resources. However, some of it also returns to the atmosphere when it evaporates from reservoirs, lakes, and soil, or when it is used up by plants. The overall result of these processes builds our country's renewable freshwater resources, which are replenished year-round. Because of climate change, the amount of fresh water we can rely on varies a lot from year to year. This makes it hard to predict how much we will have in the future."}], 'type': 'callout'}]}, '95ad8579-5f03-4561-b7cd-e296e03e2fc7': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': 'Development of our freshwater resources', 'value': [{'children': [{'text': 'Development of our freshwater resources'}], 'type': 'h3'}]}, '99d8d575-337e-4f9d-9185-217772f84862': {'@type': 'group', 'as': 'div', 'data': {'blocks': {'21dc07cd-bdff-4e78-95ba-2868e20365ee': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': ' Supply of additional water resources, in million m 3 ', 'value': [{'children': [{'text': ''}, {'children': [{'style-medium-text': True, 'text': 'Supply of additional water resources, in million m'}, {'children': [{'style-medium-text': True, 'text': '3'}], 'type': 'sup'}, {'text': ''}], 'type': 'strong'}, {'text': ''}], 'type': 'p'}]}, '2330232f-d08c-42a9-bab1-d760defccfeb': {'@type': 'columnsBlock', 'data': {'blocks': {'d77ef442-0627-4e3c-9ef8-6dbdd0fab043': {'blocks': {'dd50d5e7-49bd-41a5-b029-12f62a08204c': {'@type': 'embed_visualization', 'vis_url': '/freshwater/countries/water-resources/visualizations/wr-fig-5-1.3', 'with_notes': True}, 'f1294306-8f66-4c20-992e-8a52accc6ba8': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': ' From TV8_6 to TV8_7 the supply of other non-freshwater resources, like brackish water in TV8_8 TV8_9 . 'section': True, 'styles': {}}, '3c8e1354-1561-4fe0-bb05-c99e77b7d656': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': 'In many cases, water needs to be transported from rivers, lakes, or reservoirs to the places where it is used, such as in households, agriculture, and industry. During this transport, some of the water is lost due to leakages in the water conveyance systems or simply returned to the atmosphere through evaporation or absorbed into the soil. Decreasing leakages and losses reduces the abstraction of water from surface and groundwater resources, as well as lowers the costs of water treatment and supply. This also helps improve our resilience to droughts and water scarcity caused by climate change.', 'value': [{'children': [{'text': 'In many cases, water needs to be transported from rivers, lakes, or reservoirs to the places where it is used, such as in households, agriculture, and industry. During this transport, some of the water is lost due to leakages in the water conveyance systems or simply returned to the atmosphere through evaporation or absorbed into the soil. Decreasing leakages and losses reduces the abstraction of water from surface and groundwater resources, as well as lowers the costs of water treatment and supply. This also helps improve our resilience to droughts and water scarcity caused by climate change.'}], 'type': 'callout'}]}, '42488b55-f29b-4c85-8ebe-bac14ee1172d': {'@type': 'slate', 'plaintext': 'Our communities and our economy mostly rely on surface water (rivers, lakes, reservoirs) and groundwater resources.
